title: Gregor Townsend axes Scotland captain Stuart McInally for typhoon-threatened World Cup crunch match with Japan
text:
In normal circumstances, the Scotland head coach dropping his captain to the bench before what is effectively a World Cup knockout game would rank as a bombshell.

Yet with Typhoon Hagibis approaching Tokyo followed by a potential legal tailwind, Gregor Townsend’s decision to axe Stuart McInally barely registers as an airgun pellet fired into a hurricane.

Fraser Brown takes McInally’s place at hooker with wings Darcy Graham and Tommy Seymour the only other survivors from the side who beat Russia 61-0 on Wednesday.

With Scotland’s World Cup fate hanging in the balance, experienced scrum-half Greig Laidlaw assumes the captaincy.
